p: For Ruth and others that received their HIV diagnosis during pregnancy, their diagnosis compounded pre-existing anxieties about being a mother, predisposing them to develop PND. One woman in her fourth pregnancy began “wondering how [she] would be able to look after [her children] with the HIV and [kept] wondering if this was the end of [her] life” after her diagnosis (postnatal, living with HIV 1–2 years). She continually expressed her worry about her diagnosis and about how she would be able to parent while living with HIV.
